text: I'm so very sorry Harriet why should you
condone me you do not think I care about
mr. Frank Churchill that was a time
and not very distant either when you
gave me a reason to believe that you did
care about him him never do miss
Woodhouse how could you say mistake me
Harriet what do you mean I should not
have thought it possible that you could
have misunderstood me but you told me
that greater things that happened that
there had been matches of greater
disparity those were your very words
miss Woodhouse Harriet
let us understand each other now without
possibility of further mistake are you
speaking with mr. Knightley of course I
thought you knew but the service mr.
Churchill rendered you in protecting you
from the gypsies no it's not the gypsies
no I was thinking of a much more
precious circumstance with Mr
Knightley's coming and asking me to
dance when mr. Elton would not stop that
with me good god and have you any idea
of Mr Knightley's returning your
affection I must say that I have he has
dreamy sweetness and kindness
and that done well he took great pains
to describe to me some particulars for
management of tenant farms we were
interrupted but before we were he seemed
almost to be asking me why affections
were engaged yes but is it possible that
he might have been alluding to mr.
Marson that he might have had mr.
Martin's interest in view
you think of mr. Knightley for yourself
Harriet I do not flatter myself with any
idea of his attachment to me I should
have considered it she's great a
presumption you need to think of him but
you have it I know that he is the last
man who would intentionally give any
woman the idea of his feeling more for
her than he does thing if you believe he
loves you I refuse mr. Marshall are you
because
[Music]
[Music]
